Package com.aeonium.javafx.validation

This package provides deklarative validation for JavaFX user interfaces with the following goals: A simple way of declaring validation constraints on a input field, an (at best) unobtrusive way of wiring submit controls to the validation.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DefaultFXValidationCheckedHandler
    Default handler for @FXValidationChecked annotations.
    DefaultFXValidationHandler
    Handler for the following validation constraints (i.e., annotations): FXRequired, FXString, FXNumber, FXNotNull.
    FXAbstractValidator<T extends javafx.scene.control.Control,A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>
    Base class for the validator classes: Each validation case for a control gets one instance of a validator.
    NotNullValidator
    Checks (currently only) choiceboxes and comboboxes whether they have a valid selection value not equaling null.
    NumberValidator
    Checks whether input of a text control may be parsed as a double precision number and optionally whether the value does not violate min an max range constraints.
    RequiredValidator
    Validate ttext input controls as "required", i.e., they must not be empty.
    StringValidator
    Check string input, e.g., whether it fits into min and max lengths.
    ValidatorService
    This class serves as a registry for validator objects and provides methods for looking up validators of a control.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ValidationException
    Base exception for signalling validation errors â€“ a validator derived from FXAbstractValidator must throw this exception in it's FXAbstractValidator.validate(javafx.scene.control.Control, java.lang.annotation.Annotation) method, if the validation failed and the property FXAbstractValidator.isValid has been set to false.

Package com.aeonium.javafx.validation Description

This package provides deklarative validation for JavaFX user interfaces with the following goals:
  • A simple way of declaring validation constraints on a input field,
  • an (at best) unobtrusive way of wiring submit controls to the validation.

At first, primary focus are text input fields.
